main event: On 23rd July 1955, in Queens, New York, a witness reported the sighting of four spherical objects moving in pairs from east to west and west to east, with a total duration of approximately 30 minutes.
interesting points: The objects were described as moving in a pattern and appeared to have a color similar to that of a light bulb.
The witness initially believed the phenomenon to be characteristic of something supernatural and not aircraft.
A follow-up investigation suggested the possibility of the lights being caused by searchlight activity in the Times Square area of New York City.
The witness estimated the objects to be approximately five miles from the location and about the size of a pea held at arm's length.
The investigator's summary indicated a conviction that the lights observed were the four spherical objects, attributing the sighting to a misunderstanding regarding distance and azimuth.
sighted object: four spherical objects moving in pairs
witnesses: a 24-year-old automobile insurance adjuster with a college degree
